Privacy Policy

Scope of this Policy

  • All content published on the National Human Rights Museum website (hereinafter referred to as "this website"), except for those not subject to copyright under the Copyright Act (such as laws, regulations, speeches written by public officials, press releases, etc. â€” please refer to Article 9 of the Copyright Act), including written descriptions, photographs, images, recordings, videos, and other information, are protected by copyright law.
  • Content not subject to copyright as mentioned above may be freely used by anyone, and we encourage its wide use by the public.
  • For content on this website protected by copyright law, except for cases of fair use, the consent or authorization of the copyright holder must be obtained before use.
  • The term "fair use" is explained as follows:
  • Except as provided in Article 80-1 of the Copyright Act, where rights management electronic information may not be legally removed or altered, or in cases where it must be removed or altered due to technical requirements during recording or transmission system conversion, the rights management electronic information marked on this website may not be removed or altered without permission.
